instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Power
threads.message:
Hi, 

I have a MacBook Pro 2017 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A board with no power. The board is requesting19.69v and draws about 0.180mA then goes to about 0.355mA. After about 10 seconds or so from the charger being plugged in and the amp draw increasing to 0.355mA it goes back down to 0.000 then goes back up to 0.355mA and hangs there. The CPU is warming up after a minute or 2 while the charger is connected. USB mouse also gets power if that somehow helps?

I measured L7210 with my multimeter and it reads 0.95v and doesn’t come down.

not sure what to do. Any help would be appreciated.

board isn’t liquid damaged either.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Power
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

There should be some fault history, even not liquid damaged.
Test the board alone on the desk; nothing more than cjarger connected.
CPU core should drop to 0.6V aprox, when the board boots.

You can try known good BIOS.
